DBIT_XTOG-G59pQnqUwuag.text: Posted this in the Da Paolo Pizzabar by accident. That's a different outlet. Refer to my other review below - those items were better!Blackforest cake ($8.80) - 3.5 starsThe alcohol taste is strong but pretty flavorless - enough to give me a hint of headache for nothing. I liked the cherries, but there's too much cream and too little cake - and it's the sort of cream that's tasteless and greasy. Not many cherries inside.Tiramisu - 4 starsVegetable salad ($12) - 3.5 starsGood.Vegetable lasagna ($11.50) - 3.5 starsGood!Smoked salmon pizza ($8) - 1 starWay too salty!

D2If5QFcCyhFjmtF63Yl9A.text: The coffee and baked goods are very good. The cream crodo (I think that's what it's called?) is a cronut covered in sugar and filled with cream. It is a very good, albeit not healthy, piece. The caffe latte is also very good. The salmon and horseradish sandwich had a bit too much horseradish but it was by no means a bad sandwich. Overall, a very good place to drop in for breakfast, brunch, or a snack. Also a good place to get some work done.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Paolo Gastronomia - Holland Village - Singapore, Singapore. Cream crodo with caffe latte

Kv8OlS-uX_lbal__0EqQ2A.text: I have been looking for a nice cafe to read books on the weekends, and feel like I have found a perfect spot. Gastronomic offers a wide selection of drinks, pastries, and food with plenty of comfortable seating both inside and out. I would definitely come back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Da Paolo Gastronomia - Holland Village - Singapore, Singapore. Great clean and modern ambiance with plenty of seating, even on a Saturday afternoon!

soykkVdVPNEv3bm3cm8eVA.text: I love this place! Reminds me of Larchmont Wine and Cheese in Los Angeles but slightly better. Great sandwiches and coffee! Highly recommend this place for a brunch or lunch! Friendly staff.. I was recommended the roast beef sandwich, got half and it's quite huge. Got a latte. Delish. Show you pics :)

photos.caption: Photo of Da Paolo Gastronomia - Holland Village - Singapore, Singapore. Fried eggs with sausage and onion
Photo of Da Paolo Gastronomia - Holland Village - Singapore, Singapore. Chicken and Brie sandwich on ciabatta
Photo of Da Paolo Gastronomia - Holland Village - Singapore, Singapore. Mozzarella basil sandwich on ciabatta with iced mint tea

1F-ALtEf5woOSffjw1GWoQ.text: Gastronomia has been a mainstay at Chip Bee for awhile and recently went through a minor revamp. It used to be solely focused on take aways but they now offer seating space with an extended menu to choose from for a simple, fast meal. Cafe plus takeaways! And it's never crowded, and a nice place to sit with a book, a friend, or just a cup of coffee. A surprising fact is their breakfast offerings (which goes on all-day). Very inexpensive, and huge portions. Scrambled eggs are creamy and good, and their egg sets can come with smoked salmon, sausages, according to your choice. Huge portions for around 10 - 15 bucks. They also offer soup + pizza combinations, and I think some sandwiches (haven't tried this). Get your breakfast cravings here and be more satisfied than elsewhere at Holland Village. I'm very happy about their revamp.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Paolo Gastronomia - Holland Village - Singapore, Singapore. Their new breakfast menu. Portions are huuuuge.

XvBRhlHormj1WrXgzj9Y_A.text: Needed dinner, couldn't walk after a busy day, and sent partner in here to "grab something, anything" so there you go! Starved but not for long! He picked up the veggie lasagna which was bursting with every veggie and lots of flavor. He had the beef lasagna and loved that as well. Both takeaways were big slabs of lasagna, easy to nuke in the microwave and then gobble down. He also got the baked cheesecake and that was also very nice. Of course this place has happy hour with good specials we'll have to try next time.

ymG0qq76dJV39zaH2kvwug.text: Part of the Da Paolo group, this bistro is located on a quiet street in a residential area. It's more relaxing than the main holland village stretch, and quiet idyllic.I had a sandwich and a cottage pie. Everything was freshly baked on the day itself, and my sandwich came stuffed full of goodness. The bread was crisp on the outside an still warm, while the cottage pie was very hearty and tasty. Still, it wasn't anything to shout about. Like it's coffee. And I'd have to be really hard pressed to make my way all the way here just for pizzas or breads.Ambience wise, it's nothing really special. The chairs aren't too comfortable and it's got a very limited seating capacity. Definitely no good for large groups. Still it's clean and cheerful, ad the glass front lets in the afternoon sun.The large colourful meringues caught my eye but I did not get any as I was stuffed from my "snack". I'll definitely be back to try them if I'm in the neighbourhood!

photos.caption: Photo of Da Paolo Gastronomia - Holland Village - Singapore, Singapore. Counter
Photo of Da Paolo Gastronomia - Holland Village - Singapore, Singapore. Chicken sandwich
Photo of Da Paolo Gastronomia - Holland Village - Singapore, Singapore. Cottage pie

d5lpvZxp6_6E3edpAUh7lw.text: I am an incredibly regular consumer of desserts at this Da Paolo. If you've never had a dessert box (in the self-serve fridge), I suggest you don't. Everything in that fridge is delicious, made of high quality ingredients, relatively good value on a $/g basis and packed in a convenient albeit non-environmentally friendly container.Despite attempts to contain my greed, my partner and I religiously eat 2 desserts every week. I like all the chocolate cake permutations, especially the giant $8 slice of chocolate & vanilla sponge. I also love the lemon tart sans the sweet frosting on top. He likes the dragon role and tiramisu (if you want to prevent addiction, DON'T touch this pick me up!).If you live in the area and need a quality dessert fix to go with your video ez DVD rental for the night, Da Paolo is it.

3hFJrzbgR9HfJ4N76BSmsA.text: Best ciabatta in town, hands down. This upmarket Italian deli is very consistent and I have come to rely on them for last minute dinner party details often rushing in for some grilled veggies and cheeses. The desserts in the fridge might look modest in their little plastic tubs but don't be fooled by appearances. The hazelnut crunch cake is perfection and they do a damn fine tiramisu. Skip the cupcakes. They store them open air with the air con blowing over them so they are dry dry dry. If you get there first thing in the morning have a fresh doughnut or croissant and an espresso.

p9zZxV4GIcGq6e2fbhCE_w.text: I've been coming here for years to buy the slices of pizza or pre-cooked food (that you can just take home and heat up, like the lasagnas). In a now competitive deli scene, it now stands out as being okay. But not great. There's also gelato. Which is also okay. The Da Paolo group really needs to step it up, they're no longer in the prime position they were at, at their peak!

S7pmvOgdebPo2NKGUqK7-A.text: This place is a life-saver, especially their ciabatta, marinated artichokes, and pesto sauce. I think it is also one of the cheaper places to buy Parmegiano Reggiano, although nothing in Singapore beats stuffing an entire checked bag with groceries in Rome.

J5qrSQ8GwqJrw1q2zjZnRg.text: This is my cheat sheet when I need to prepare dinner and I have no time or energy to muster. Located in the tranquil neighborhood of Chip Bee Gardens, Gastronomia has a decent selection of pasta sauces, antipasto, mains and pizzas that you can just grab and go. Probably won't be the meal of a lifetime and isn't exactly the most economical solution to your laziness but one has to make do with shortfalls. The salmon pizza with pesto is a great choice to accompany beers during game night. If you are have about 15 minutes to spare and put in a tad more 'effort', get some tagliatelle and arrabaitta sauce to put together in the kitchen later on. Sauces tend to have little ingredients though, so stop by the Cold Storage across the road to grab something to spice it up if you will. If it is a hot day out there, have a scoop of gelato before you make your way home - it's nice enough to put you in a better mood.

aLRbxAIa38ieXXcETjxr2g.text: I give this place 4 stars, cos it's always there when I need it :) Croissants, donuts for breakfast, delicious sandwhiches for lunch and pre-cooked food for dinner. They have a whole fridge stacked with choclate desserts, my favorite the flourless chocolate cake and the peanut chocolate cake which is basically the same as eating 15 snickers. Staff is very friendly as well. Coffee is a bit watery so i always get the capucino or espresso.

photos.caption: Photo of Da Paolo Gastronomia - Holland Village - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Da Paolo Gastronomia - Holland Village - Singapore, Singapore. Inside the gastronomia

UEQQOj6U5Pw1PsDAyqDxxQ.text: Gastronomia is a solid location for a quiet peaceful lunch spot in the Holland Village area for a nice sandwich. I have definitely come here for a peaceful solitary lunch on more than a few occasions. My favorite is the sausages with caramelized onions on crispy ciabatta bread. Its delicious. I always get the half sandwich because the portion is huge. My mother is a fan of their chocolate cakes.

clD_zai0Bid7gulID-DfVA.text: Whenever I'm asked by friends about where should they go to get good desserts, I always recommend them to go to Da Paolo Gastronomia. I have seriously liked everything that came out of their cake cooler so far and I can't decide which is the second best after the Tiramisu because they are all so darn good.
